title: About Me
text: My name is Tyler Hurst and I am a junior advertising and public relations, sports media and communications double major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. At UNL, I work under the Creative Media department for the football team and serve as an ambassador for the College of Journalism and Mass Communications. This summer, I was a social media intern and team photographer for the Lincoln Saltdogs, an independent professional baseball team, where our team won the leagueâ€™s Social Media Team of the Year award.

title: About
text: Hello my name is Tyler. I am a junior advertising and public relations, sports media and communication major in the College of Journalism and Mass Communications at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. On campus, I serve as an ambassador and front desk representative for CoJMC and work under the Creative Media department for football.

title: How Northwestern Won the 2018 Big Ten West
text:
text goes here


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggbump)
library(patchwork)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggalt)
library(ggtext)

BigTenWest18v2 <- read_csv("BigTenWest18v2.csv")
BigTenWest18Ydsv2 <- read_csv("BigTenWest18Ydsv2.csv")
NorthwesternWinScoreDiff <- read_csv("NorthwesternWinScoreDiff.csv")

northwestern_data <- BigTenWest18v2 |>
  filter(Team == "Northwestern")

ggplot() + 
  geom_bump(data=BigTenWest18v2, aes(x=Game, y=Wins, color=Team), alpha=.6) +
  geom_point(data=BigTenWest18v2, aes(x=Game, y=Wins, color=Team), size = 3, alpha=.3) +
  geom_point(data=northwestern_data, aes(x=Game, y=Wins, color=Team), size = 4) +
  geom_bump(data=northwestern_data, aes(x=Game, y=Wins, color=Team), size = 1) +
 scale_color_manual(values = c("#E84A27", "#FFCD00", "#7A0019", "#E41C38", "#4E2A84", "#CEB888", "#C5050C")) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(2,4,6,8,10,12)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  plot_annotation(
    title = "How The West Was Won",
    subtitle = "Northwestern football prevailed after a 1-3 start in\n2018, closing the season on a 7-1 record.",
    caption = "Source: Sports-Reference.com | By Tyler Hurst"
  ) & 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )





text goes here


Code
BigTenWest18Ydsv2 |>
  group_by(Team) |>
  summarise(
    TotalPlays = sum(OffPlays), 
    TotalYards = sum(OffYds), 
    DefensivePlays = sum(DefPlays), 
    DefensiveYards = sum(DefYds)) |>
  mutate(
    OffensiveYPP = TotalYards/TotalPlays, 
    DefensiveYPP = DefensiveYards/DefensivePlays) -> ypp

averages <- ypp |> ungroup() |> summarise(AvgOffYardsPer = mean(OffensiveYPP), AvgDefYardsPer = mean(DefensiveYPP))

west_teams <- c("Northwestern", "Illinois", "Iowa", "Minnesota", "Nebraska", "Wisconsin", "Purdue")

west <- ypp |> filter(Team %in% west_teams)

east_teams <- c("Ohio State", "Indiana", "Michigan", "Michigan State", "Penn State", "Maryland", "Rutgers")

east <- ypp |> filter(Team %in% east_teams)

team_colors <- c("Illinois" = "#E84A27", "Iowa" = "#FFCD00", "Minnesota" = "#7A0019", "Nebraska" = "#E41C38", "Northwestern" = "#4E2A84", "Purdue" = "#CEB888", "Wisconsin" = "#C5050C")

 ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data=east, aes(x=OffensiveYPP, y=DefensiveYPP), color="light grey", size = 1.4) +
  geom_point(data=west, aes(x=OffensiveYPP, y=DefensiveYPP)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept=5.524939, color="dark grey") + 
  geom_vline(xintercept=5.726772, color="dark grey") +
  geom_text(aes(x=6.25, y=5, label="Good Offense, Good Defense"), color="#151515", size = 2.5) +
  geom_text(aes(x=4.75, y=5, label="Bad Offense, Good Defense"), color="#151515", size = 2.5) +
  geom_text(aes(x=4.75, y=6.5, label="Bad Defense, Bad Offense"), color="#151515", size = 2.5) +
  geom_text(aes(x=6.25, y=6.5, label="Bad Defense, Good Offense"), color="#151515", size = 2.5) +
  geom_text_repel(data=west, aes(x=OffensiveYPP, y=DefensiveYPP, label=Team, color=Team)) +
  geom_text_repel(data=east, aes(x=OffensiveYPP, y=DefensiveYPP, label=Team, color=Team), size = 2.8) +
  labs(x="Average Offensive Yards Per Play", y="Average Defensive Yards Per Play", title="Nobody Said It Would Be Pretty", subtitle="Despite the title of Big Ten West divison champions, Northwestern ranked near the bottom\nin offensive yards per play and sported a sub-par defense, compared to other conference teams", caption="Source: Sports-Reference.com | By Tyler Hurst") +
  scale_color_manual(values = team_colors) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    plot.caption = element_text(size = 7),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 6),
    axis.ticks = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank()
  )





text goes here


Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_dumbbell(
    data=NorthwesternWinScoreDiff,
    aes(y=reorder(Opponent, ScoreDiff), x=TeamPts, xend=OppPts),
    size = 2,
    colour = "grey",
    colour_x = "green",
    colour_xend = "red") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title="Squeaking Out Wins",
    subtitle = "The longer the line, the more points Northwestern won by in the regular season.",
    x = "Points Scored (Red = Opponent, Green = Northwestern)",
    y = "Opponent",
    caption="Source: Sports-Reference.com | By Tyler Hurst") + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_textbox_simple(),
  )
